persona.name: Maria Rodriguez
persona.demographics: 32-year-old immigration attorney seeking client's federal records
persona.motivation: Legal representation requiring complete immigration file

request.record_type: Complete A-file (Alien Registration File) including all immigration documents, correspondence, and proceedings

contact_info.office: USCIS National Records Center, FOIA/PA Office

request.statutory_basis: 5 U.S.C. § 552 (Freedom of Information Act) and 5 U.S.C. § 552a (Privacy Act)
request.request_text:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I hereby request access to and copies of all records pertaining to [CLIENT NAME], A-Number: [A-XXXXXXX], Date of Birth: [MM/DD/YYYY].

Specifically, I request the complete A-file (Alien Registration File) including but not limited to:

1. All Forms I-94 (Arrival/Departure Records)
2. All visa applications and supporting documentation
3. All adjustment of status applications (Forms I-485)
4. All naturalization applications and supporting documents
5. All correspondence between USCIS and the individual
6. All administrative decisions, orders, and appeals
7. All biometric information and photographs on file
8. All background check results and security clearance documentation
9. Any records transferred from legacy INS files
10. Any records related to detention, removal proceedings, or enforcement actions

I am the authorized attorney representing [CLIENT NAME] in immigration proceedings. Enclosed please find Form G-28, Notice of Entry of Appearance as Attorney or Accredited Representative, signed by my client authorizing this request.

As this request involves records pertaining to my client's ongoing legal proceedings, I respectfully request that processing be expedited under 8 C.F.R. § 103.10(b)(1)(ii) due to urgency involving a person primarily engaged in disseminating information with urgency to inform the public about actual or alleged federal government activity.

If any portion of this request is denied, please specify which exemption(s) apply and provide a detailed explanation. If fees are anticipated to exceed $25, please contact me before processing. I request a fee waiver as this information is being sought on behalf of an individual regarding their own records and will primarily benefit the public interest in understanding immigration procedures and individual rights.

Please provide responsive records in electronic format when possible. If you have any questions regarding this request, please contact me at [PHONE] or [EMAIL].

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Respectfully submitted,

Maria Rodriguez, Esq.
State Bar No. [NUMBER]
[LAW FIRM NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[PHONE] | [EMAIL]
request.fee_handling: Request fee waiver for individual client records; willing to pay up to $25 without pre-approval

likely_challenges: Privacy Act may require additional client identity verification
Security-related portions may be redacted under FOIA Exemption 7(E)
Processing delays due to high volume of immigration FOIA requests
Potential additional fees for extensive records
success_indicators: Receipt acknowledgment within 20 business days with tracking number
Complete A-file production including historical INS records
Minimal redactions limited to legitimate security concerns
Electronic delivery in searchable PDF format
expected_outcomes.appeal_strategy: If denied or excessively redacted, appeal to DHS Office of General Counsel emphasizing client's right to own records and attorney's legitimate need for legal representation
expected_outcomes.timeline_estimate: 20-60 business days for standard processing; 10-20 business days if expedited processing granted

key_requirements: Form G-28 mandatory for attorney requests on behalf of client
Specific A-number required for efficient processing
Privacy Act and FOIA should both be cited for comprehensive coverage
common_pitfalls: Failing to include proper attorney authorization
Not being specific enough about records sought
Not requesting expedited processing when appropriate
optimization_tips: Use online portal for faster processing and tracking
Include specific form numbers and document types
Reference ongoing legal proceedings for expedited processing

real_world_context.success_rate: High (85-90%) for properly formatted requests with correct authorization
real_world_context.common_redactions: Security clearance details, law enforcement sensitive information

key_learning_objectives: Fee waiver justification for client records
